alert.note: Alert for Macon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 10:43PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Macon County through 1115 PM CDT... At 1043 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clarence, or 9 miles east of Macon, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Macon County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for north central Missouri.
